title: Back in 1969, the price for one day of Woodstock was $6
body:
Or $18 For a three day pass. And you got to see big, big name bands play. Not just one band, but a whole bunch of em. I think there were 32 bands that played? I'm not sure. 

 Now? You have to play like $100 just go to see a guy press the space bar on a laptop and then do nothing the rest of the show, or they might pretend they're doing something, but we all know they're just faking it. 

I feel like I was born in the wrong era.. music wise at least. Music today is a joke, for the most part. The industry has become too greedy.
